title: Random Fps Spikes
body:
I have been having some major fps drops in game going from 200 fps to about 40 this is really frustrating me as the game becomes harder it seems when you have low fps. I have ran anti malware and updated my drivers but that didn't seem to resolve the issue. I received a new card for Christmas and installed it so I don't know if it is because of the new map or what but If anyone can help me that would be great!

Specs
GPU: Geforce GTX 160 3GB
CPU : AMD-FX 4300 quad core
Ram: 8GB

replies.body:
Is it on the snowy rift map?
Because on regular rift, my FPS is solidly at like 60-80, but on snowy rift, I get under 30 constantly (and at one point, even zero.)
Yes that is what I was initially thinking when I saw these drops is there a way to get rid of the snow?
For now, only custom games and ranked do not have the snowy theme. I'm not too sure how to turn it off for normal games.

Have you resolved your problem? I have had this problem since beta client update. Tried going back to legacy. Tried different drivers. I also know its the game because I play Overwatch on max settings and get 90fps. I have used gpu-z and noticed that when i play overwatch, my card is being used at 99% , when I play league. its at 30%

There could be a few things causing this to happen, the most common being incorrect windows power settings or the specific driver you're using is problematic. I recommend working through our [**FPS Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) to ensure all the common solutions have been tried before we investigate further. For the first step, I'd recommend using [**Nvidia's Full Driver Search**](http://www.nvidia.com/Download/Find.aspx?lang=en-us) so you can try different drivers out.

Let me know if those steps caused any change for you.

these didn't seem to do anything as my framerates are way lower than they should be as a card that can run games like doom are only getting 60 fps on league of legends which actually baffles me. I believe it has something to do with the game itself but I have no idea why if ayou could help me out with that I would really appreciate it.
Which driver versions did you try out when you were testing them out?
The current drivers that I am using is the GeForce game ready drivers version 376.33

Gotcha. We may need to try a few different drivers, but at this point, I'd like you to reach out to our tech specialists in a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and be sure to attach some logs with our [**HRT App**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) for the quickest service time!

Let me know if you have any issues with those steps.
